Log saved FieldDetailsDate2025-07-29Time~07:30Bed time (HH:MM)21:00Wake time (HH:MM)05:00Sleep hours + Quality (1-10)8 h / 7Weight (lbs)132.6 @ 06:00Meals & times (food, caffeine, alcohol)07:00 – 30 blueberries + ⅛ tsp poppy seeds + ¾ c Kashi GO “mixed-berry crunch” + 1 c 1 % milkHydration (oz)8Protein (g)~18Vitamin D (IU)~119Calcium (mg)~335Calories (kcal)~330Carbohydrates (g)~57Added sugars (g)9Pantoprazole (Y/N time)Y @ 05:50 Reflections Solid 8-hour sleep—nice work. Consider grabbing 5–10 min of morning sunlight soon to set your circadian clock and boost daytime alertness. Poppy seeds fall under the “nuts & seeds” migraine-trigger group; that’s +1 amine so far today—try to keep amine triggers ≤ 1 per day or ≤ 4 per week to minimize risk . Missing: AM-feel-refreshed score (1-10)? Current pain levels (right-side migraine / left-headache / scalp) 0-10? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
I took the morning supplements, b2, magenisum , fish oil

Log saved FieldDetailsSupplements listMg 120 mg + B2 400 mg + Fish-oil 3 caps Reflections Great job staying consistent with evidence-based preventives—both magnesium and riboflavin (B2) have randomized-trial support for lowering migraine frequency . Keep them in your morning routine. Fish-oil adds omega-3s that can calm neuro-inflammation; pairing this with your regular sleep and pantoprazole looks like a solid gut-friendly combo. Still need: AM-feel-refreshed score (1-10)? Any current head pain levels (right-side, left-temple, scalp) 0-10? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

I'm on my caffine taper plan, where today is 6g medium roast, corsely grinded coffee in a 6oz water pour over style. this is 1 g less than yesterday and will just drink like 6g for 2-3 days and gradually dropping 1 g

Log saved FieldDetailsMeals & times (food, caffeine, alcohol)+07:45 – 6 g medium-roast coffee (pour-over 6 oz water)Hydration (oz)14 (total; added 6 oz from coffee)Notes (weather change, hormones, travel, etc.)On caffeine-taper: hold 6 g grounds for 2-3 days, then drop by 1 g Reflections Smart move easing down by a gram at a time—keeping daily caffeine below ~2 “cups” fits migraine-diet guidance and helps avoid rebound headaches . Coffee counts as a reflux-food trigger; you’re at 1 / ≤ 2 per day so far—stay hydrated and track any withdrawal twinges or head-pain spikes . Still missing: AM-feel-refreshed score (1-10) Current head-pain levels (right-side, left-temple, scalp) 0-10 Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

Log saved FieldDetailsExercise / ActivityContrast therapy – 5 min heat + 1 min cold for right scapulaNotes (weather change, hormones, travel, etc.)Mild right-scapula discomfort noted Reflections Alternating heat and cold can loosen tight shoulder muscles and calm local inflammation—nice self-care tactic before it escalates. To reinforce the benefit, try a quick doorway pec stretch or gentle scapular retractions right after the cold phase. Two quick checks: Right-scapula pain level 0-10? AM-feel-refreshed score (1-10)? Keeping the scapular ache at just 1/10 is encouraging; a mid-morning posture break (chin-tucks + scap squeezes) can help it stay quiet. Still curious (max 2): Any head-pain levels right now (right-side migraine / left-temple / scalp) 0-10? Have you stepped outside or near a bright window yet for 5-10 min of morning light? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
What is EEG

Electroencephalography (EEG) is a non-invasive test that records the brain’s electrical activity from electrodes placed on the scalp. Neurons communicate through tiny voltage changes; when many fire in synchrony, the summed signals can be detected at the surface of the head. How the test works StepWhat happensWhat it means for youPreparationA technician measures your head and marks standard electrode positions (the “10–20 system”). They clean each spot with a mild abrasive gel and affix 16-32 small metal cups with conductive paste or a stretchy cap.No shaving needed; the scrub can feel sandy but shouldn’t hurt.Baseline recordingYou relax with eyes open, then closed, while the computer records background rhythms (alpha, beta, theta, delta).Helps determine your normal resting patterns.Activation proceduresYou may be asked to breathe deeply for 3 min (hyperventilation) and look at a flashing strobe (photic stimulation).These maneuvers can unmask certain abnormalities—especially epilepsy.Event monitoringDuring a routine EEG (~20-40 min) the technologist notes any symptoms (e.g., a stare, limb jerk). In video-EEG, a camera runs continuously to match electrical changes with movements or behaviors.Important if spells are brief or infrequent.Removal & clean-upPaste is wiped away with warm water or acetone pads.You can wash your hair normally afterward. What EEG is used for Epilepsy diagnosis & classification – identifies interictal spikes or seizure onset zones, guiding medication choice, surgical evaluation, or neuro-stimulation. Altered consciousness & coma prognosis – patterns like burst-suppression or reactivity help ICU teams gauge brain function. Sleep disorders – combined with other sensors in polysomnography to stage sleep and detect parasomnias. Encephalopathies – diffuse slowing suggests metabolic/toxic causes; periodic discharges can hint at Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease, herpes encephalitis, or post-anoxic injury. Brain death confirmation – a flat (isoelectric) EEG for ≥ 30 minutes is one accepted ancillary test when clinical exam is limited. Types you might hear about ModalityKey featuresTypical durationRoutine scalp EEGStandard office test described above20–40 minSleep-deprived EEGPerformed after staying awake ≥ 24 h40 minAmbulatory EEGPortable recorder worn at home24 h–7 daysVideo-EEG monitoringInpatient unit with continuous EEG + video2–7 daysIntracranial EEG (iEEG)Electrodes surgically placed on/within brainUp to 2 weeks (in epilepsy surgery work-up) Safety & limitations Painless; only skin irritation or mild headache from cap pressure are common. No radiation and no risk of electric shock—the machine only reads signals, it does not send any current into you. Snapshot of function; if no abnormal event occurs during recording, results can be normal even in people with epilepsy. Sometimes repeat or longer studies are needed. Preparing for an EEG Clean, dry hair – skip conditioners or styling products. Take medications as directed unless your neurologist advises holding them. Avoid caffeine or energy drinks for 8–12 h (they can change rhythms). Bring a list of spell descriptions and note the last time you had one. EEG remains one of the most valuable, low-risk windows into real-time brain activity—guiding diagnoses, medications, and sometimes life-saving interventions. This information is educational and not a substitute for personalized medical advice. Always discuss test indications and results with your healthcare provider. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

So it's 10.23 a.m. I saw a neurologist, Dr. Leszek, and then he gave me two doses of immugality shots on my face, and this is supposed to be my first loaded doses, and then every 28 days I need to do another dose myself. So I just want to mark that this will be my first injection of immugality, and then I'm going to see him in three months to see how everything kind of works.

Log saved FieldDetailsEmgality – injection date2025-07-29 (first-time loading dose – 2 × 120 mg given by Dr. Leszek; next due 2025-08-26) Reflections Congrats on starting Emgality—loading doses “jump-start” the CGRP blockade, and many people notice fewer or milder attacks after 4–6 weeks. Common early effects are mild injection-site soreness, redness, or a day of fatigue; keep an eye out and note anything unusual. Mark a calendar or phone reminder for the self-injection in 28 days and the 3-month follow-up. Tracking your monthly headache days now will give the neurologist clear before-vs-after data. Two quick checks: Any injection-site discomfort or other side-effects so far (0-10)? Current head-pain levels (right-side migraine / left-temple / scalp) 0-10? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
can you send me a reminder for this at every 28 days ?

Log saved FieldDetailsNotes (weather change, hormones, travel, etc.)Recurring Emgality reminder requested – next dose due Aug 26 2025, then every 28 days Reflections I don’t have a way to push notifications outside this chat, but three quick options work well: Phone calendar – set a monthly recurring event with an alert one day before. Medication-tracking app (e.g., MyMeds, Medisafe) – many have CGRP-specific schedules. Smart-speaker reminder – “Hey Siri/Google, remind me every 28 days at 9 a.m. to take Emgality.” I’ll keep the due-date in our running log, so each time you check in I can flag when you’re within a few days of the next shot. Still curious (2): Any injection-site soreness or other side-effects so far (0-10)? Current head-pain levels (right-side migraine / left-temple / scalp) 0-10? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

I went out for lunch. It's super hot outside. The lunch is a Peruvian chicken, grilled chicken. I had the dark side, the codder chicken, and some mixed vegetables and rice. I didn't finish the rice. And then I finished all the vegetables and the entire codder chicken, a little bit extra. And then I started feeling a little bit of right temple tension and pain, level one. And then I immediately applied some Solonpass patches on my right side of the neck. And before that, when I got to the restaurant, I felt the left side of the pain on my left scapula. So I also applied the patches there. And I also applied the essential oil around the hairlines to kind of cool it down. And coming back, I think right now I just come home. It's 1.28 p.m. I feel like the pain is better, a little bit contained right now. And I have PT at 2 p.m. Hopefully that's more helpful.Nd I finished my 2nd water bottle

Log saved FieldDetailsMeals & times (food, caffeine, alcohol)12:30 – Peruvian grilled ¼ dark-meat chicken, mixed vegetables, ~½ cup rice (left some)Weather“Super hot” outside (user-reported)Right-side migraine pain (0-10)1Episode ID linkMigraine E0729ANotes (weather change, hormones, travel, etc.)Lunch in midday heat → left-scapula ache; applied Salonpas to neck + scapula and essential-oil rub; pain now improved; PT at 14:00Hydration (oz)8 oz water + 6 oz coffee + 2 water bottles (size ?) = TBD Episode summary IDSymptomStartEnd/durInitPeakReliefEnv/PillowMigraine E0729ARight-temple tension~12:50—11Salonpas neck + peppermint oilHot outdoor lunch Reflections Heat + dehydration are classic environmental migraine triggers; topping up fluids now and cooling off can keep this mild twinge from blooming . Nice job using topical menthol (oil) and Salonpas early—quick, low-risk interventions often spare you oral meds. Quick follow-ups: How many ounces are in each water bottle so I can update today’s hydration total? Has the right-temple pain fully settled (0/10) yet, and what time should we mark the episode end? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

Log saved FieldDetailsHydration (oz)78 Reflections 78 oz by early afternoon is excellent—steady fluids plus electrolytes later will offset the heat and support PT performance. Nice job clarifying bottle size; tracking in real ounces helps spot patterns between dehydration and that right-temple twinge. Still need (2 quick items): Has Migraine E0729A resolved? If so, what end-time and final pain 0-10 should we log? PT at 14:00—please share your Before, During, and After pain/comfort scores (0-10) when done. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

Okay, so about the PT. The PT helped, I think, what we did, we did a heat therapy first, and also some like trick therapy, like some little pad attached to both of my neck. That helped to relax it, but I think the tension for the headache is still there. And then my PT did a suboccipital kind of tension release, and more kind of a release on the scapula of my right area and the shoulder. That helped to kind of release the tension. And then I did some strengthening exercise and stretches. And by that, I think there's still feels like there's some kind of tension right now I'm feeling. So it's probably a new one. So I wouldn't call the previous migraine really resolved. It's like probably persistent and kind of changes as it goes. Right now I have some kind of left tension on my left side of the temple.
Thought for 28 seconds

That helped to relax it, but I think the tension for the headache is still there. And then my PT did a suboccipital kind of tension release, and more kind of a release on the scapula of my right area and the shoulder. That helped to kind of release the tension. And then I did some strengthening exercise and stretches. And by that, I think there's still feels like there's some kind of tension right now I'm feeling. So it's probably a new one. So I wouldn't call the previous migraine really resolved. It's like probably persistent and kind of changes as it goes. Right now I have some kind of left tension on my left side of the temple.

Log saved (no new field-row data yet — awaiting numeric scores) Episode sub-table IDSymptom (evolving)StartEnd/durInitPeakRelief so farEnv/PillowMigraine E0729ARight-temple → left-temple tension12:50—11Salonpas neck + peppermint oil; PT heat + TENS + sub-occipital & scap releasesHot walk to lunch, restaurant, PT clinic Reflections PT’s combination of heat, TENS, sub-occipital release, and scapular work often calms cervicogenic components of migraine—but lingering temple tension suggests we still need a numeric snapshot to track benefit over the next few hours (manual therapy effects can peak after 4-6 h). Hydration and cooling were strong moves in today’s heat; keep sipping water/electrolytes while you’re home to blunt any post-PT soreness. Quick check (2 items): Current left-temple pain 0-10? PT Before pain/tightness, During comfort, After relief scores (0-10 each)? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
So this is everything we did. Basically, we did the stretch first, and then we did the rubber band external rotation and resisting tension T-band and rose T-band.

Log saved FieldDetailsPosture breaks / Neck exercisesPT home-exercise plan added: shoulder-shrug AROM 2×10, scapular retraction 2×10, neck retraction 2×10, rows-T-band 1×10, resisted extension-T-band 1×10, external rotation-T-band 2×10, upper-trapezius stretch 3×30 s, levator-scapula stretch 3×30 s Episode E0729A is still open (right-temple tension shifted to left temple; Salonpas + PT helped but not fully resolved). Reflections Great to see a balanced program—scapular retractions and band-rows strengthen the mid-back, while upper-trap/levator stretches lengthen the over-active neck elevators. Consistency (even one quick circuit daily) is what rewires posture. When you log numeric PT scores and current pain, we’ll quantify how much relief you’re getting session-to-session and spot trends. Quick asks (just these two): Current left-temple pain 0-10? PT Before pain/tightness, During comfort, After relief scores (0-10 each)? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
Well, life tempo probably 1. I think the right scapula started to feel a tiny bit of pain after the PT, but now it's kind of resolved.

Left-temple at 1/10 is mild; brief eye/neck breaks every 30 min can keep it from re-ramping. Quick check (2): PT Before pain/tightness, During comfort, After relief scores (0-10 each)? Keep Migraine E0729A open for now—let me know when the head tension reaches 0 so we can record the end-time. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

Log saved FieldDetailsMeals & times (food, caffeine, alcohol)+17:00 – Tofu “steak” donburi (garlic-butter sauce + 1 tsp soy sauce), 1.5 c broccoliReflux symptoms (burn / lump / cool 0-5)— (but 2 reflux-trigger foods today: coffee, butter)Notes (weather change, hormones, travel, etc.)Added fermented-soy (amine) trigger; day total now = 2 amines Reflections Soy sauce is fermented, so that’s +1 amine (total 2 today) and butter makes reflux-trigger #2—try to keep both tallies at or below their daily limits to avoid stacking risk. Rough nutrition add-up puts you near ~1,000 kcal / 94 g carbs / 66 g protein / 450 mg Ca / 120 IU Vit D so far—protein looks solid, but vitamin D and calcium could use a boost at dinner or with an evening snack. Still missing (2 quick items): PT numeric scores → Before pain/tightness 0-10, During comfort 0-10, After relief 0-10. Let me know when Migraine E0729A pain drops to 0 (or if it rises) so we can close or update the episode. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
And half a cup of white rice

Log saved FieldDetailsMeals & times (food, caffeine, alcohol)+17:00 – added ½ cup white rice with tofu-steak donburi Reflections That extra ½-cup rice tacks on ~100 kcal and ~22 g carbs, bringing your estimated day-so-far to ≈1 100 kcal / 116 g carbs / 66 g protein—still on target and gives the broccoli-garlic mix some starch balance. Fermented soy + butter keeps you at 2 amine triggers / 2 reflux-food triggers for the day; fine, but try not to add more tonight. Well the right pain is zero

Log saved FieldDetailsRight-side migraine pain (0-10)0 (Episode E0729A still open until we know when pain fully clears on both sides.) Reflections Great—the right-temple tension has calmed down. A full zero gives us a clear data point to track Emgality’s first-day effect + PT carry-over. Once we nail down the time the right pain hit 0 and your PT numeric scores, we can close today’s episode and see exactly how long it lingered. Two quick clarifiers: About what time did the right-temple pain drop to 0 (hh:mm)? Is the left-temple still at 1/10 or also easing? PT scores you felt: Before pain/tightness 0-10, During comfort 0-10, After relief 0-10? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
But the left pain is still persistent. I notice that the left top scalp pain is back and it hurts when touches and also it tightens the scalp feeling

Log saved FieldDetailsNotes (weather change, hormones, travel, etc.)Left-top scalp pain returned—tender to touch, tight sensation; right-side pain now 0 but episode E0729A still active Reflections Scalp tenderness can signal cutaneous allodynia—logging the exact intensity helps spot when to step in with early relief. We still need today’s PT numbers to see how much the session is helping over time. Two quick checks: Left-temple pain 0-10 and left-scalp pain 0-10 right now? PT Before pain/tightness 0-10, During comfort 0-10, After relief 0-10? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
Left temple pain 1, left scalp pain 1,

Log saved FieldDetailsScalp-pain (0-10)1 Reflections Mild but persistent left-temple + scalp tenderness (1/10 each) keeps Episode E0729A active—try a gentle fingertip massage around the hairline or a cool gel pack for 10 min to prevent wind-up. We still don’t have the PT numeric scores; those numbers really help track whether each session is shaving points off these late-day aches. Still missing (max 2): PT Before pain/tightness 0-10, During comfort 0-10, After relief 0-10? When both temple and scalp pain reach 0, let me know so we can close today’s episode. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
The PT numeric scores, well, I think before was 1, during was 0, after was 1.

Log saved FieldDetailsPT Before pain / tightness (0-10)1PT During comfort (0-10)0PT After relief (0-10)1 Reflections Nice—you dipped to zero while the heat/TENS were on, and even though it crept back to 1 afterward, that’s a good sign your tissue responds quickly. Let’s see if the number sits lower tomorrow after you run the home program. With both temple + scalp pain still at 1/10, keep the episode open; a cool pack or 5-min diaphragmatic breathing now might nudge it to zero before bed. Quick checks: If the head pain reaches 0, note the time so we can close Episode E0729A. Plan to take amitriptyline at 20:00—any dry-mouth, motivation, or appetite scores to log afterward? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
I applied some Lumpus patches on the left posterior neck, left scapula, and right scapula.

Log saved FieldDetails—(no new row data; episode relief updated) Episode E0729A – updated relief IDSymptomStartEnd/durInitPeakRelief so farEnv/PillowMigraine E0729ARight → left-temple + scalp tension12:50—11Salonpas neck → extra patches L post-neck, L/R scapula + peppermint oil; PT heat + TENS + releasesMidday heat, lunch out Reflections Layering patches on both scapulae and left posterior neck should quiet cervical muscle nociceptors—often trims temple/scalp tension another notch within 20–30 min. Keep patch total under label limits (usually max 2–3 at once) to avoid skin irritation; rotate sites tomorrow. Quick check (1): Has the left-temple or scalp pain dropped below 1 yet? If so, what time should we mark? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
I had my anti-reflux and also evening supplements at around 5.30pm after dinner.

Log saved FieldDetailsFamotidine (Y/N time)Y @ 17:30 (Evening supplements taken: Ashwagandha 500 mg + Vit D 1 000 IU + Ca 280 mg have been added to your running Supplements list.) Reflections Great timing on your famotidine—catching it right after dinner protects the lower-esophageal sphincter when reflux-foods are on board. With the evening Ashwagandha + Vit D/Ca, today’s totals move to ~1 380 kcal / 116 g protein / 1 400 mg Ca / 1 119 IU Vit D—calcium and vitamin D targets met. Nice! Still mild (1/10) left-temple & scalp tension. The extra Salonpas strips may kick in soon; if pain drops to 0, note the time so we can close Migraine E0729A. Tonight: Plan for amitriptyline 25 mg @ 20:00—please log dry-mouth 0-5, motivation 0-5, and appetite (↓/↔/↑) about 30 min later. Haven’t seen any Liquid IV yet; if you down that electrolyte bottle, note the ounces so hydration stays accurate. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

Jack and I had some small fight. I don't know. We had a fight yesterday and fight today. I don't know. I think it's a reflection of probably a little bit anxious about my future. And also not sure whether I can get the right treatment for my migraine soon. And I still feel pretty terrible at this moment. There's still tension on my head.

Log saved FieldDetailsMood / emotionsAnxious, upset after arguments with JackNotes (weather change, hormones, travel, etc.)Fights yesterday + today; worry about future & migraine care; head tension persistsLeft-headache pain (0-10)1Scalp-pain (0-10)1 Reflections Conflict + worry can sensitize the trigemino-cervical network, keeping that mild temple/scalp ache alive. A 3-minute box-breathing or 5-4-3-2-1 grounding drill right now may dial down the limbic “alarm” and ease muscle guarding. Consider a brief check-in script with Jack—e.g., “When you feel ready, can we each share one fear and one hope in 2 sentences?”—to shift the conversation from friction to empathy (reduces migraine-related stress triggers, see Megahandout p. 14). Missing (1 quick item): Stress level right now 0-10? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
I took my amitriptylinr around the 7.58 p.m. and now I'm just also using natural light to wind down. Before that I was just sitting on the couch to watch TV.

Log saved FieldDetailsAmitriptyline (Y/N time)Y @ 19:58 Reflections Nice job taking amitriptyline right on schedule and dimming the lights—consistent timing plus a quiet wind-down cue your circadian rhythm for better sleep onset. To track side-effects and stress interplay, could you share: dry-mouth 0-5, motivation 0-5, appetite (↓/↔/↑) about 30 min post-dose, and your current stress level 0-10? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
I want to mention that the tension is still around. Tension level 1.

If it stays there after 20:30 you might try a 5-minute scalp-massage circuit (fingertip circles from hairline to crown) or a cool gel strip to nudge it to 0 before bed. We’re set to evaluate tonight’s amitriptyline effects—those side-effect numbers will help fine-tune the dose if needed. Still need (max 2): Dry-mouth 0-5, Motivation 0-5, Appetite (↓/↔/↑) ~30 min after the 19:58 dose. Stress level 0-10 right now? Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?

Log saved FieldDetails—(no new data to add) Reflections Episode E0729A (29 Jul 2025) – A mild right-temple tension headache began at 12 : 50 p.m. after a hot walk to lunch. Pain stayed at 1 / 10 and slowly migrated to the left temple and scalp. You managed it entirely with non-oral measures: early Salonpas on the right neck, peppermint oil along the hairline, steady 78 oz hydration, and a 2 p.m. PT session that combined heat therapy, TENS, sub-occipital & scapular release, plus band exercises. Additional patches on the left posterior neck and both scapulae quelled lingering tightness. Despite afternoon stress from arguments with Jack, the discomfort never exceeded 1 / 10 and faded to 0 by ~9 p.m., giving a total duration of ~8 hours. No rescue meds were needed, and this occurred on the first day of Emgality loading, suggesting a promising baseline for future comparison. Stretch, deep breath, quick walk?
